etymology.description: 湊(湊) (còu, "gather"), 湊(湊) (còu, "gather"), 火(火) (huǒ, "fire"; "meal")
etymology.interpretation: The phrase 湊湊火 (còu còu huǒ) literally involves the act of gathering 火(火) (huǒ, "fire"; "meal"). In context, it connotes the idea of improvising to make do with the available resources for a meal, often by quickly putting together something casual. This reflects a cultural attitude towards frugality and adaptability in situations where one might not have all desired ingredients or time.

examples.chinese: 今晚的晚饭只能凑凑火(今晚的晚飯只能湊湊火)。
examples.pinyin: jīn wǎn de wǎn fàn zhǐ néng còu còu huǒ
examples.english: We can only make do with tonight's dinner.

examples.chinese: 工作日加班时(工作日加班時)，办公室里只能凑凑火(辦公室裡只能湊湊火)。
examples.pinyin: gōng zuò rì jiā bān shí, bàngōng shì lǐ zhǐ néng còu còu huǒ
examples.english: On workdays when working overtime, the office can only manage a makeshift meal.
